comment: Dr. Powell is a great professor. She takes the time to recognize students who do well. There are weekly map assignments which must be done carefully, they are graded strictly.

If you do the reading and put in the effort, you will do well in her class. Also, actually try on the map assignments, and even if they are not perfect, she will recognize the effort put into them and provide good feedback. You don't have to participate in the weekly discussions online, but do the study guides - they'll help you a LOT on tests!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Honestly this class makes me laugh at how seriously it is taken for an 1101 class. First, get ready for +100 slide power pts. you have to complete in a week (I recommend taking notes because it'll help for the test). I haven't read a single word from the textbook and have managed to make a high B on all tests thus far. Maps are extremely tedious.
Her tests are hard and you have to do a map each week that takes several hours to do.  You also have to do a study guide for each test, but she doesn't go over the answers to it.  Hard class.

The online class is ok, but you have a lot of work each week.  You have to do a map every week that takes about 2 hours and read each chapter and do the study guide.  That's 3-4 hours.  Her tests are online, but they are hard.  You have to know the material.  You cannot google most of the answers.  She will answer any questions that you have.

Online classes definitely require more work than campus classes.  Professor Powell gives you everything you need to do well on the exam, as they are quite hard and picky.  If you don't do her study guides, which don't have answers, you won't pass the class.  Also, many of her questions are from the book and you cannot google them. She is helpful

If you actually want to learn something about geography, this is a good class.  a lot more work that some of my friends who have Doran, but I actually learned something as Doran's class is a joke.  You can get an A if you study and download her powerpoints.  You have 12 maps to do also, can drop 2.  She's nice and courteous.

I can't say it was an easy A but if u read and prepare well for the tests(which are hard) and follow closely the guidelines for the assignments you should be fine. She is very fair, gives detailed feedback and replies super fast. Also very organized and clear expectations which made me honestly enjoy the class...

For the online class, tests are open notesopen book, but you cannot google the answers.  if you don't know the material you won't pass the class.  each test covers about 3 chapters.  i'm an a student and I knew the chapters very well and only made a b.  most people seem to make c.  you have map assignments but they take way too long to do.

She is nit picky on map assignments.  If you are off 1mm, you lose points.  Nice teacher, but she expects way too much from her map assignments.  I worked for several hours on 2 maps for a meager score.  Her tests are very hard, but she gives you a long time to work on them.  You learn a lot, but it is not an easy class by any  means.

She should notice that most of the geog 1101 classes at Kennesaw are easy freshman level classes.  This class is the work of 2 classes and the reading material is very difficult.  It is not possible to memorize this much material.  She should give out powerpoints that actually have the ANSWERS to the questions.  Hers don't really help.  Stay away.

There are a total of 12 maps that you have to turn in almost weekly and there are about 4-5 tests. YOU MUST READ THE BOOK TO PASS THE TEST. Google will not work. You get to make up ONE missed or low test grade at the end of the semester. She is super nice but the test are ridiculous. Mostly fill in the blank and little multiple choice.

Super nice instructor!Discussion board posts that are not mandatory but helpful. 12 easy map assignments in which only 10 will actually count. 4 exams total for entire semester that mainly comes from PowerPoint slides! Passed the class with 5th edition book which was way cheaper. Download and save PP slides. You will need them to study for test.
Took this course online and it was easy she didn't ask for much and was fear on grades

Unlike many other posters, I found her to be organized,helpful, and easy. The weekly discussions are optional. She has map assignments that she is way too picky on. Tests are straight out of the notes. I took it online which probably helped.
Took her online.  Did EVERYTHING she asked, still struggled.  Tests were not worded correctly. Not the worst class, fairly easy , but still to hard for a 1101 class.
Worst Prof. ever. She states her religious beliefs by demeaning other religions. She does not need to teach. And any geography prof. who says all roads lead to Paris needs a swift kick in the a@#

Who ever said she was smart is as brilliant as this teacher. She tries to exceed the boundries of geography, and fails miserably. Taking this class with history, she constantly contradicter herself and my history book. Does not prepare you for the tests, they are vague, confusing questions of absolutes...Please don't take this class, for your sake

I couldn't get up the interest to attend this class often, and when I did attend, it was a fight to stay awake. Her note sheets are all fine and dandy, but if you don't go to class, you're not going to pass the tests.

This professor needs to take break from teaching.  She is condescending and rude to students. Her tests have nothing to do with what she talks extensively about in class and she tries to cover too much material.  Long story short... the Department Head got involved and then a syllabus change and extra credit was given.  Don't risk your A with her.

Everyone saying this class is easy is whack. I went to every class and took notes made note cards, the whole shibang and when I got the test nothing I wrote and studied was on there. The only easy part are the map quizzes. She changed the syllabus 3 times. Very vague on what to study. Just read the book.

The first test is very hard.  Go over the questions at the end of the notes she gives you, know the vocabulary at the beginning of each chapter.   All 3 Tests are multiple choice.  12 map quiz's, lowest grade dropped.  Offers extra credit to your FINAL grade.  No laptops.  I probably would not take her again.  She tries to cover too much.

An easy A if you go to class.  The project is an easy 100 and you can get up to 10 bonus points added to your final average.  Attendance in mandatory for the extra credit, so pencil this class in as a must go.  It will take a bit of studying but it's an A for the taking.
she is an amazing teacher. Print the notes, highlight what she says...memorize....thats the WHOLE test. Shes very interesting. Enjoy her!

She is a very good teacher. She explains the subject with enthusiasm. She doesn't tollerate late arrivals or computer use. I have an A in the class - it wasn't easy -but she did provide all the info that I needed to study. 10 pts extra credit can be added to FINAL/TOTAL average. Worth taking her for sure!!!
Whoever said she was crazy...is crazy!! SHES A GREAT TEACHER AND SO NICE!!very passionate! and helpful.
Tests were just ridiculous, she does NOT do a good job of telling preparing you for the tests and they cover SO much material. NOT an easy class.
shes way easy and gives pretty much all the answers to the test before hand. show up to class!

i learned more history in this class than i did in my actual history class. but every class is a lecture and you print off the notes, so its easy to stay on track. shes very smart and will give you many bonus points just from attendance so be at class! and as long as you at leadt sit down and study once in a while you'll get a easy A

She lectures a lot. Very passionate about geography. You can print all the notes online and bring them to class. If you study the notes and vocab in each chapter, then the tests are pretty easy. A lot of memorizing tho. Final is not cumulative. Gives a lot of extra credit if you go to class most days. ATTENDANCE IS VERY IMPORTANT!

She's very interested and passionate about her subject, which is nice. There is so much material that it can be overwhelming. She takes attendance and gives extra credit based on that. She also gives other opportunities for extra credit, which is how I got an A. Her tests are hard, but getting an A was not too hard.
